page.title: 20 Barham's Local Issues
page.content: In the past year the Parish Council passed 36 planning applications for building. Most of them were for renewal of permission, the original time limit of five years having lapsed.The council also wanted the general public and people using the bowling green, which it owns, to pay for its upkeep. Many accidents, some fatal, have occurred at the Barham crossroads on the A2 to Dover in recent years. The Parish Council amongst others, has fought long and hard for a flyover. The Government has finally agreed to rebase the necessary money and work should be underway this year. The issue of street lighting in the village took 50 years to come into effect. After it was first mentioned there was a lapse of 15 years before the next discussion. Even when success came in 1968, the council still had complaints from the public.
